solution_line_template: Jerome bought {last_month_bought} x {times_more_this_month} = <<{last_month_bought}*{times_more_this_month}={this_month_bought}>>{this_month_bought} toy cars this month.
So he bought a total of {last_month_bought} + {this_month_bought} = <<{last_month_bought}+{this_month_bought}={total_bought}>>{total_bought} toy cars.
Therefore, Jerome had {total_now} - {total_bought} = <<{total_now}-{total_bought}={originally_had}>>{originally_had} toy cars originally.
